title: Real Madrid 'set sights' on Manchester United target Erling Haaland
text:
Real Madrid are plotting a move to sign Manchester United target Erling Haaland after the striker's excellent start to the season.

According to AS, the Spanish giants are lining up a bid to bring the 19-year-old to the club next summer.

The Leeds-born forward has scored 18 goals in 11 matches for Red Bull Salzburg this term, catching the eye of Los Blancos boss Zinedine Zidane.

Red Bull Salzburg striker Erling Haaland celebrates Champions League victory over Genk

HAALAND IN 2019-20 Appearances: 11 Minutes: 795 Goals: 18 Hat-tricks: 3 Assists: 5

Madrid have had mixed results this season and have become heavily reliant on Karim Benzema for goals, a predicament which may encourage Florentino Perez to pursue Haaland as soon as January.

The Norwegian rose to stardom this season by scoring a hat-trick on his Champions League debut against Genk, and turned heads in England with a goal against Liverpool at Anfield.

The teenager, who is the son of former Leeds and Manchester City midfielder Alf-Inge Haaland, made his full international debut last month. He featured alongside Bournemouth's Josh King in Norway's 2-0 win over Malta.
description: Real Madrid are plotting a move to sign Erling Haaland after the striker's excellent start to the season. The Spanish giants are lining up a move to bring the 19-year-old to the club next summer.
